channel.title: DirectX Water
channel.description:
I have known about this since Jagex released it, but I have never been able to use it because of my old crappy computer. Now that I got a new one today, I was able to use it in full HD without any lag at all. I think the DirectX water looks is amazing. The water also moves.
Here is a photo of what it looks like: [img]http://i.imgur.com/7BaGO.jpg[/img]
So, what do you think of it?

item.title: DirectX Water
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:40, topic:426797”][quote author=Uncalled link=topic=529495.msg3867623#msg3867623 date=1325117848]
Yeah, but there’s versions [right?] so, RuneTek 5 would be the newest, am I wrong?
[/quote]

RuneTek 5 is just the game engine. It refers to the different techniques they are allowed to use. For 5, this specifically means particles, procedural textures, advanced shaders, etc. So to say that the water exists through RuneTek 5 is not as accurate as saying it exists because of the capabilities of RuneTek 5, and thereby could not exist on any previous RuneTek engine (which is accurate, because RT4 could not support the shaders needed for this water).[/quote]I see, thank you very much for explaining that to me.

Read full topic

item.title: DirectX Water
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

Different RuneTek engines include different schemes of client set ups, such as the string utility that started in 3 and then was removed in 4. RuneTek 5 always had bloom in it, I think RuneTek 4 did too I’d have to check my clients, but then it wasn’t added in until much later into RuneTek 5. The start of RuneTek 3 had the old cache system and then towards 414, they starting moving to the most modern JS5 system. In the middle of RuneTek 3 they changed their software rendering a bit and how the layout for that looked. There are a lot of changes but the most common thing I see when Runescape declares a new ‘RuneTek’ engine is the set up of how each class file is declared. It’s really easy to see that they script most of their client, and I think as they come out with new versions of their scripting languages (possibly Jagex Script 5, dunno) they release new engine versions for their client.

Food for thought.

OT:

This water update is still shit.

Read full topic

item.title: DirectX Water
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Uncalled:

Yeah, but there’s versions [right?] so, RuneTek 5 would be the newest, am I wrong?

RuneTek 5 is just the game engine. It refers to the different techniques they are allowed to use. For 5, this specifically means particles, procedural textures, advanced shaders, etc. So to say that the water exists through RuneTek 5 is not as accurate as saying it exists because of the capabilities of RuneTek 5, and thereby could not exist on any previous RuneTek engine (which is accurate, because RT4 could not support the shaders needed for this water).

Read full topic

item.title: DirectX Water
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Uncalled:

I mean that the water is altogether good, just doesn’t fit in the current game engine.

Aha, but that has nothing to do with the engine itself. The engine is a series of algorithms and code, not content. You mean the water doesn’t work with the content theme Jagex setup, not with how the RuneTek 5 engine works (as opposed to everything else).

Read full topic

item.title: DirectX Water
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Uncalled, post:33, topic:426797”][quote author=sinisoul link=topic=529495.msg3867405#msg3867405 date=1325108983]

[quote author=Uncalled link=topic=529495.msg3866894#msg3866894 date=1325063866]

Why can’t they just keep Runescape looking semi-realistic. I loved the RuneTek 4 engine graphics and they just seem to love and fuck them up with each update.
[/quote]RuneTek 3 was the best.

Ah yeah RuneTek 3 and 4 > 5
[/quote]Yep.

OT:
Water is good, looks like shit on RuneTek 5 though.[/quote]

What? I don’t understand how this makes any sense. The current client engine is RuneTek 5. The water on the OP is running through RuneTek 5. How can something on RuneTek 5 be good, but look like shit on RuneTek 5.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:23, topic:426797”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=529495.msg3865313#msg3865313 date=1324954022]

I actually don’t like how it looks. It doesn’t actually look very realistic, and it doesn’t fit the colorful theme of RuneScape at all, unlike the OpenGL water.

This.
As a matter of fact, I don’t see all those damn customs had to do with the medieval setting RuneScape came out for in the beginning? Since when in the Hell did we have Chaotic Rapiers, Dragon Defender and what not in the medieval time period?

Anyway, that is nice water but doesn’t match RuneScape’s setting.

Well, RuneScape was always based on medieval/fantasy. Even as far back as the original RSC, you had magic.
[/quote]But then again, magic isn’t a concept exclusive to medieval fantasy whatsoever.[/quote]

How about “magic that works.”
